get_summary_stats

Source: R/utils.R
get_summary_stats.Rd

Compute all relevant summary statistics given a dataframes of all numerical columns.

Usage

get_summary_stats(data)

Arguments

data

a dataframe

Value

a dataframe

Examples

X <- sim_clust(2, 100, dmin = 0.5, rmin = 0.3, nind = 10)
get_summary_stats(X)
#>                   x1         x2          x3          x4          x5         x6
#> mean      0.11532265  0.1947641 -0.39809865  0.20538578  0.06254031  0.3190094
#> sd        1.07081257  0.9766181  0.89270102  1.01288501  1.07701097  1.0777094
#> min      -3.20797371 -2.5080183 -2.57911178 -1.79338414 -2.40765448 -1.8638184
#> max       2.78090995  2.6636734  2.07049806  2.75925081  2.38446277  3.2322935
#> skewness -0.15189339  0.0665163  0.36819493  0.21307002 -0.02382439  0.3287224
#> kurtosi   0.06398198  0.1462915  0.24375290 -0.55058415 -0.20755161 -0.2946790
#> q25      -0.65433184 -0.4001773 -1.03439272 -0.47943475 -0.63512850 -0.4776002
#> q50       0.16719244  0.2141514 -0.43855493  0.03777461  0.14115309  0.2150271
#> q75       0.86009290  0.6443706  0.05970249  0.95773762  0.62955868  0.9852431
#>                   x7         x8          x9        x10      group
#> mean      0.07814744  0.1328127 -0.29418792 -0.3398682  1.5000000
#> sd        1.01376009  1.1580456  1.12780411  1.0089200  0.5025189
#> min      -2.11082250 -2.1540892 -2.86730897 -2.8184559  1.0000000
#> max       2.40425524  2.6716816  2.63682297  2.4722480  2.0000000
#> skewness  0.19024420  0.1454981  0.01263414  0.1609591  0.0000000
#> kurtosi  -0.66501361 -0.6775193 -0.09412446 -0.2658460 -2.0199000
#> q25      -0.80338369 -0.7530186 -0.91553091 -1.0783768  1.0000000
#> q50       0.02089320  0.1742949 -0.32074048 -0.3158301  1.5000000
